lead_paragraph: Turks of all stripes believe the United States was involved in the coup attempt, especially because the cleric suspected of leading it lives in Pennsylvania.

byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and CEYLAN YEGINSU

headline.print_headline: Turks Agree on One Thing: U.S. Was Behind Failed Revolt
headline.main: Turks Can Agree on One Thing: U.S. Was Behind Failed Coup

snippet: Turks of all stripes believe the United States was involved in the coup attempt, especially because the cleric suspected of leading it lives in Pennsylvania....
abstract: Wide array of Turks believe United States was behind failed coup attempt there, with some charging America orchestrated effort to assassinate Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan; negative sentiment towards US dates to end of World War I, when West carved up Ottoman Empire, and has been inflamed by presence of cleric Muslim Fethullah Gulen in US.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
